metadata.title: CVE-2021-4140 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
It was possible to construct specific XSLT markup that would be able tobypass an iframe sandbox. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.5,Firefox < 96, and Thunderbird < 91.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '96.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
